definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)

sentences.english: Cui Yongyuan is a famous talk show host .
sentences.chinese: 崔永元是著名的脱口秀主持人。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 300 sentences, you can make a living in America.
sentences.chinese: 脱口而出300句英语，你可以在美国工作。

sentences.english: If we had another name for this meat, people wouldn't even think twice.
sentences.chinese: 你若问起这种肉的别名，人们想都不想就会脱口而出。

sentences.english: The whole idea evolved from a casual remark.
sentences.chinese: 整个想法是由一句脱口而出的话演变而来的。

sentences.english: One day Cosette chanced to say "father" to him.
sentences.chinese: 有一天珂赛特脱口叫了他一声“父亲”。

sentences.english: As a result, networks will be rerunning some late-night talk shows and soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 结果是，网络将播放一些午夜脱口秀和肥皂剧。

sentences.english: Every day I am blurting out more sentences.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，我都在脱口而出更多的句子。

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情绪激动之时，明镜险些将明楼的真实身份脱口而出。

sentences.english: That show was renamed "The Oprah Winfrey Show" in 1985.
sentences.chinese: 这档节目在1985年改名为《奥普拉脱口秀》。

sentences.english: The comedian's ad-libs were quoted in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那喜剧演员的脱口妙语被引述在报纸上。

sentences.english: I think talk shows are non-sense.
sentences.chinese: 我认为脱口秀一点意思也没有。

sentences.english: Julia blurted out by accident. “I never imagined you being a doctor!”
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亚脱口而出，“我还真不知道你还是个医生。”

sentences.english: "It has become more than a show, " Chen says.
sentences.chinese: “这个节目已不仅仅是一场脱口秀，”陈鲁豫说。

sentences.english: A job interview is a one-direction conversation, like on a talk show。
sentences.chinese: 工作面试是单向的谈话，像脱口秀一样。

sentences.english: The world is tired of the death blurting out or muttering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 世界厌倦透了脱口而出或再三沉吟的死亡。

sentences.english: But after finishing saying, again to displeased the words that blurt in times before not already.
sentences.chinese: 可是说完之后，又对先前脱口说出的话懊恼不已。

definition: to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
to have heard what was said
slip of the tongue/indiscretion/to blurt out a secret
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
